message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we first factor out the common terms in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator: (8x^2 - 2x)
Factor out the common term 2x:
2x(4x - 1)

Denominator: (4x^3 - 8x)
Factor out the common term 4x:
4x(x^2 - 2)

Now, the rational expression becomes:

(2x(4x - 1)) / (4x(x^2 - 2))

We can now cancel out the common term 2x from both the numerator and the denominator:

(4x - 1) / (2(x^2 - 2))

This is the simplified form of the given rational expression.
